page.title: 11Religion in Eglwysbach
page.content: The name of the village means little church and the church is dedicated to St. Martin. The date of the first church is unknown but the first vicar's name was David (1537).Church records from 1605 tell an interesting story about the village. The present building dates from 1837. The Wesleyan Methodist church was built in the 19th century. Local Baptists were attending meetings in a nearby village two hundred years ago but the local chapel was built in 1878. The Calvinistic Methodist chapels at each end of the village were built in 1884 and boast the largest congregations. There has been a steady decline in church and chapel attendance since 1945, but fifty years ago worship and Sunday School teaching in Welsh saved the language from extinction. Declining attendance now threatens the language.
